item.title: Broken loose paving slabs a/s minerva square, 23rd February
item.description:
These paving slabs have cracked and the mortar beneath has washed away. The cracks have sharp edges and the slabs rock significantly when stepped on, causing the sharp edge to be exposed. I tripped on a part of the slab as it rocked, jabbing the exposed sharp corner into soft tissue just below my ankle. I am still in pain the next day. The slabs are alongside Minerva Square, shortly before Montague Close becomes a private road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Montague Close, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on box junction, 23rd February
item.description:
There is a very large and deep pothole on the left hand side of the box junction at the entrance to the car park. This is a danger to cyclists and motorcyclists and could also potentially cause damage to car wheels/tyres.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Row, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 broken covers recent repair but that was pointless one cover is cracked across, 23rd February

item.title: Another Banging Drain cover, 23rd February
item.description:
Another banging drain cover. There are two banging drain covers that keep us awake. Especially as the road is used by night buses. One is outside 48 Stoke Newington Church Street (already reported), and this one outside 52. Doubling the noise!!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet
